results.title: Crash Zone: It's Only Words
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel, Buena Vista International, Patricia Edgar, Anthony Morris and Esben Storm
results.brief_description:
A computer virus invades Catalyst and it’s a fight against the clock to save Alex’s game ‘Trillin’ and indeed, the whole of Catalyst. The kids are not at their best as there’s friction between Mike and Bec. Bec believes he should have stood up for her when his friends made racist comments to her. No matter how much Mike apologises, the team is edgy.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Identity Crisis
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel, Buena Vista International, Patricia Edgar, Philip Dalkin and Ray Boseley
results.brief_description:
Testing Alex’s new game, ‘Trillin’, the kids encounter Virgil, who is having an identity crisis. The surprised Alex is worried that Virgil might be a spy for rival company Sunijim. An offended Virgil gets the kids to help him prove he’s not a spy - but Virgil can’t remember who he really is! The kids discover Virgil has actually grown from a program created by Alex.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Heroes
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel, Buena Vista International, Patricia Edgar, Kevin Nemeth and Ray Boseley
results.brief_description:
Marcello feels rejected when Alex dismisses his idea for a video game based on Virgil. Mike too is deflated when he finds that his hero, Stig MaCallister, creator of his favourite comic, is rude and aggressive. Tempted by an offer from Sunijim representative, Brad Kane, Marcello eventually realises Brad is an even bigger scammer than himself.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Birthday
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel, Buena Vista International, Patricia Edgar, Kevin Nemeth and Esben Storm
results.brief_description:
Marcello’s unemployed father is acting strangely and Marcello believes he’s cracking up. While Bec has created her own game about gnomes, Marcello becomes convinced his father is going to kill himself. The kids, confused by Pi’s depression, Bec’s game and Marcello’s weirdness, are unsure exactly who is really cracking up.
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash Zone: Big Business
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel, Buena Vista International, Patricia Edgar, Max Dann and Ray Boseley
results.brief_description:
Marcello tries to make money selling Ram’s new invention. Ram, realising Marcello is ripping him off, dissolves the partnership and then sells one of his amazing new game converters to a strange girl, Louise. Unfortunately Louise’s TV blows up and she blames Ram. Will the other kids be able to save Ram before he becomes a meal for Louise’s huge dog, ‘Predator’?
Stars Frances Wang as Bec, Damien Bodie as Ram, Cassandra Magrath as Pi, Paul Pantano as Marcello, Nikolai Nikolaeff as Mike and Nicki Wendt as Alex.

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 6. Season 2. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel Australia, Bernadette O'Mahony, David Swann, Ray Boseley, Julie McSwiney and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: Virgil the A.I. manifests himself within a robotic body and runs away from Catalyst. The kids must track him down before Alex finds out he’s gone. Episode 11: Army Intelligence raid the offices of Catalyst looking for Virgil. The team does all they can to save him from conscription. Episode 12: To her fury, Pi discovers her father is exploiting her on the Net to further his acting career and sets out to show him how she feels. Episode 13: When a game Ram has conquered on the Net turns out to be a scenario for a real-life kidnapping, the team must stop a band of criminals from adopting Ram’s strategy. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 5. Season 2. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel Australia, Bernadette O'Mahony, David Swann, Ray Boseley, Julie McSwiney and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: Marcello alienates himself from the team when he uses a ‘cheat’ website to help him beat Bec in the school essay contest. Episode 7: After Bec returns from a trip to Silicon Valley in the USA, her cocky too-cool-for-school attitude threatens the effectiveness of the team. Episode 8: Marcello’s latest scheme, a “virtual band”, takes off and he becomes, on paper at least, a millionaire. But has he really hit the big time? Episode 9: A famous hacker steals Alex’s new game. When Marcello realises the hacker is someone he knows he has to make a difficult decision. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 4. Season 2. Eps 01-05
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel Australia, Bernadette O'Mahony, David Swann, Ray Boseley, Julie McSwiney and Steve Steve Jodrell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 1: The second season of the series opens with Catalyst on the brink of financial ruin. The kids find an electronic solution to the company’s woes. Episode 2. An inventor brings radical 3-D classes to Catalyst and Alex and the team must select the perfect game for showcasing them to the world. Episode 3: The lure of a program that can order all the free stuff from the Net automatically inspires Marcello’s latest brainwave. Episode 4: The kids are torn between their principles and their allegiance to Alex when they go on strike for better conditions. Episode 5: Mike becomes drawn in to a violent game on the Net after he breaks up with Pi. Things get out of hand when ‘Damon’, an evil character from the game follows Mike into the real world. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 3. Season 1. Eps 10-13
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel Australia, Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley, Pino Amenta and Stephen Johnson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 10: When a stranger arrives at Catalyst with a new game he claims to have invented, Alex is eager to invest in it. When Mike discovers the game is stolen he teams up with Pi to save Alex from embarrassment. Episode 11: Marcello and Mike are forced to face some home truths about people they have idolised. Episode 12: After Marcello throws Catalyst into panic when he hacks into the computer system, the rest of the kids have to decide where to place their allegiances - with Marcello or Alex. Episode 13: When Virgil is ‘captured’ by opposing games company Sunijim, Marcello attempts to redeem himself in Alex’s eyes by rescuing him. After he also runs into difficulties the friends use their computer skills to save them both and reunite the Crash Zone team. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv

results.title: Crash zone. Vol. 2. Season 1. Eps 06-09
results.creator_credit: Australian Children's Television Foundation, Disney Channel Australia, Patricia Edgar, Esben Storm, Ray Boseley, Pino Amenta and Stephen Johnson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Crash zone”.
Episode 6: When Bec begins a ‘Net romance’ the boys are sceptical. Their worst fears are realised when they discover that it is Virgil, their A.I. friend that is wooing her. Episode 7: Bec and Pi have differences of opinion when they design a game for girls about teenage romance. The resulting mess causes the team to acknowledge they still have a lot to learn about emotions and life. Episode 8: When a reporter arrives at Catalyst to do a story on the testers, they have suspicions she may be a spy. Pi, who has led the gang to believe she is a street kid, is unmasked when her mother tracks her to the company. Cast includes Paul Pantano, Cassandra Magrath, Nikolai Nikolaeff, Frances Wang, Damien Bodie, Nicki Wendt and Matthew Parkinson. Teaching resources can be found at: http://www.actf.com.au/learning_centre_new/Learning_frameset.htm Accompanying website at: www.crashzone.tv
